# mail-check

> Verify if email addresses actually exist — without sending them.

mail-check is a free, open-source email verification tool that checks syntax, MX records, and SMTP deliverability in one shot. Available as a web app and CLI.

## Features

- Single and bulk email validation (up to 100 per request)
- MX record lookup to verify the domain accepts email
- SMTP mailbox probing to test deliverability
- Catch-all domain detection
- Disposable/temporary email detection
- CSV import and export for bulk results
- Rate limited to 100 requests per 10 minutes per IP

## API

POST /api/check

Request body:
```json
{ "emails": ["user@example.com"] }
```

Response:
```json
{
  "results": [
    {
      "email": "user@example.com",
      "reachable": "safe",
      "syntax": { "valid": true },
      "mx": { "found": true, "records": ["alt1.gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com"] },
      "smtp": { "deliverable": true, "responseCode": 250 },
      "isCatchAll": false,
      "isDisposable": false
    }
  ]
}
```

### Reachability statuses

- `safe` — Email exists and is deliverable
- `risky` — Deliverable but domain is catch-all or disposable
- `invalid` — Bad syntax, no MX records, or SMTP rejection (5xx)
- `unknown` — Could not determine deliverability

## CLI Usage

```
npx tsx cli.js user@gmail.com              # single check
npx tsx cli.js a@test.com b@test.com       # multiple
npx tsx cli.js --csv emails.csv            # CSV file
npx tsx cli.js --json user@gmail.com       # JSON output
```

## Tech Stack

- Next.js (App Router) + React + TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS v4 + shadcn/ui
- Node.js DNS and net modules for MX/SMTP checks
